message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper deals with text segmentation algorithms that use semantic word embeddings, which are commonly used in natural language processing (NLP) tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. The paper also discusses optimization techniques and iterative refinement, which are common in machine learning and optimization, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The use of semantic embeddings also suggests a connection to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which deal with similar topics in different contexts.
